0: {"SPACE": {"var1":{"short_description":"Short description of var1", "data_type":"Data type of var1", "initial_value": 0.5, }},"var2":{"short_description":"Short description of var2", "data_type":"Data type of var2", "initial_value": -1.0}}Q:How can I get the index of the first occurrence of a character in a string?I have a string like this:string = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ1234567890"And I want to find out what's the index of the first occurrence of a letter from A to Z. For example, if my input is "B", it will return 2 because B is the second letter after A. How do I do this?A:You could use enumerate() function along with ord():>>> s = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ1234567890">>> next((i for i, c in enumerate(s) if ord('A') <= ord(c) <= ord('Z')), None)2This returns the index of the first occurrence of a letter between A and Z. If there isn't such letter, it returns None.If you need to handle non-letter characters, you may replace ord() with chr().A:You can use enumerate to get both the index and the character itself. Then check whether the character is within your desired range using the >= operator.index = min([enumerate(string)[i][1] for i, char in enumerate(string) if 65 <= ord(char) <= 90])print(index) # Output: 2Note that this only works for ASCII characters. You'll probably want to add some error checking here.A:Here is another way to solve this problem. It uses regular expressions to match the letters and then finds the position of the first match.import restring = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXY
